00033 class CECPacketHandlerBase {
00034     public:
00035         virtual ~CECPacketHandlerBase() { }
00036         virtual void HandlePacket(const CECPacket *) = 0;
00037 };

00050 //#warning Kry TODO - move to abstract layer.
00051 class CRemoteConnect : public CECMuleSocket {
00052 private:
00053     // State enums for connection SM ( client side ) in case of async processing
00054     enum { 
00055         EC_INIT,         // initial state
00056         EC_CONNECT_SENT, // socket connect request sent
00057         EC_REQ_SENT,     // sent auth request to core, waiting for reply
00058         EC_SALT_RECEIVED,// received salt from core
00059         EC_PASSWD_SENT,  // sent password to core, waiting for OK
00060         EC_OK,           // core replied "ok"
00061         EC_FAIL          // core replied "bad"
00062     } m_ec_state;
00063 
00064     // fifo of handlers for on-the-air requests. all EC concept is working in fcfs
00065     // order, so it is ok to assume that order of replies is same as order of requests
00066     std::list<CECPacketHandlerBase *> m_req_fifo;
00067     int m_req_count;
00068     int m_req_fifo_thr;
00069 
00070     wxEvtHandler* m_notifier;
00071 
00072     wxString m_connectionPassword;
00073     wxString m_server_reply;
00074     wxString m_client;
00075     wxString m_version;
00076 
00077     bool m_canZLIB;
00078     bool m_canUTF8numbers;
00079     bool m_canNotify;
00080 
00081     void WriteDoneAndQueueEmpty();  
00082 public:
00083     // The event handler is used for notifying connect/close 
00084     CRemoteConnect(wxEvtHandler* evt_handler);
00085 
00086     void SetCapabilities(bool canZLIB, bool canUTF8numbers, bool canNotify);
00087 
00088     bool ConnectToCore(
00089         const wxString &host, int port,
00090         const wxString& login, const wxString &pass,
00091         const wxString& client, const wxString& version);
00092 
00093     const wxString& GetServerReply() const { return m_server_reply; }
00094 
00095     bool RequestFifoFull()
00096     {
00097         return m_req_count > m_req_fifo_thr;
00098     }
00099     
00100     virtual void OnConnect(); // To override connection events
00101     virtual void OnLost(); // To override close events
00102 
00103     void SendRequest(CECPacketHandlerBase *handler, const CECPacket *request);
00104     void SendPacket(const CECPacket *request);

00400 DECLARE_LOCAL_EVENT_TYPE(wxEVT_EC_CONNECTION, wxEVT_USER_FIRST + 1000)
00401 
00402 class wxECSocketEvent : public wxEvent {
00403 public:
00404     wxECSocketEvent(int id, int event_id)   : wxEvent(event_id, id) {}
00405     wxECSocketEvent(int id)         : wxEvent(-1, id) {}
00406     wxECSocketEvent(int id, bool result, const wxString& reply) : wxEvent(-1, id)
00407     {
00408         m_value = result;
00409         m_server_reply = reply;
00410     }
00411     wxEvent *Clone(void) const      { return new wxECSocketEvent(*this); }
00412     bool GetResult() const          { return m_value; }
00413     const wxString& GetServerReply() const  { return m_server_reply; }
00414 private:
00415     bool m_value;
00416     wxString m_server_reply;
00417 };
